definition: to note clearly/to perceive
Ming Dynasty (1368-1644)/surname Ming/Ming (c. 2000 BC), fourth of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
bright/opposite: dark 暗[an4]/(of meaning) clear/to understand/next/public or open/wise/generic term for a sacrifice to the gods
short name for Chahar Province 察哈爾|察哈尔[Cha2 ha1 er3]
variant of 察[cha2]
to examine/to inquire/to observe/to inspect/to look into/obvious/clearly evident
open enquiries and secret search (idiom); to investigate openly and in secret/taking information from all sides
lit. seeing clearly the downy feathers of autumn (idiom, from Mencius)/fig. perceptive of even the finest detail

sentences.english: He has a good eye for detail and notices almost everything.
sentences.chinese: 他明察秋毫，几乎一切事情都注意到了。

sentences.english: At this level, in a game of this importance, you expect to be given a referee that can see that.
sentences.chinese: 在这样重要的比赛中你希望裁判都能明察秋毫。

sentences.english: Everything is seen as clear as crystal to the judge.
sentences.chinese: 这位法官真是明察秋毫。

sentences.english: Very soon, however, his look became keen and penetrative.
sentences.chinese: 然而，他的目光很快就变得犀利而明察秋毫了。

sentences.english: It it said that love is blind but friendship is clairvoyant.
sentences.chinese: 据说爱情让人盲目，但友谊却让人明察秋毫。

sentences.english: The trouble with the thesis is that it strains at a gnat and swallows a camel.
sentences.chinese: 这篇论文的毛病是明察秋毫而不见舆薪。

sentences.english: Someone has to be first to get the news, and some people have quicker insights than others.
sentences.chinese: 总有人第一个得到消息，有些人更明察秋毫。

sentences.english: He not only beholds in tensely the present as it is, but he beholds the future in the present.
sentences.chinese: 他不仅明察客观的现在，他还能从现在看到未来。

sentences.english: However, this small action, has long been the Tang Dynasty discover the minutest detail in everything.
sentences.chinese: 可是，这点小动作，早已被唐朝明察秋毫了。

sentences.english: It's, it's really intuition and instinct because of all the different things you're sensing.
sentences.chinese: 真正的直觉是来自你对不同事物的明察秋毫。

sentences.english: Some malpractices, and evils can not be found by clear observation, so we had to investigate privately.
sentences.chinese: 对于某些弊端，明察是无法发现的，所以只能暗访了。

definition: enlightened sage/brilliant master (flattering words applied to ruler)
please forgive me
to fool/to hoodwink/to dupe
to pardon/to forgive
insolence/insolent/ill-mannered
to calm down/to quell one's anger
lit. seeing clearly the downy feathers of autumn (idiom, from Mencius)/fig. perceptive of even the finest detail
fine hair grown by animals (or down grown by birds) in the fall/(fig.) sth barely discernible/the slightest thing/the minutest detail
official in feudal court/subject
courtier's or minister's form of address for the current Emperor
the grass roots/the hoi polloi
to punish sb (for a crime)
surname Chen
state official or subject in dynastic China/I, your servant (used in addressing the sovereign)/Kangxi radical 131
ordinary people/commoner/civilian
lies/wild talk/to tell lies/to talk nonsense/fantasy (literature)
to practice favoritism
